faq.title: Frequently asked questions about the payback of gas equipment

faqItems.q: How long does it take for HBO to pay for itself?
faqItems.a: The payback period for gas equipment depends on the cost of installation, annual mileage, fuel consumption and the difference in prices for gasoline and gas. Typically, HBO pays for itself in 1-3 years with a mileage of 15,000-20,000 km/year. With high mileage (30,000+ km/year), the payback can be 6-12 months.

faqItems.q: Is it profitable to install HBO on a car?
faqItems.a: LPG is beneficial when the annual mileage is high (from 15,000-20,000 km/year) and there is a significant difference in prices for gasoline and gas (usually gas is 30-40% cheaper). With low mileage (less than 10,000 km/year), the payback may exceed 3-4 years, which makes the installation less attractive.

faqItems.q: How to calculate savings on HBO?
faqItems.a: Savings = (Annual mileage × Gasoline consumption / 100 × Gasoline price) - (Annual mileage × Gas consumption / 100 × Gas price). For example, with a mileage of 20,000 km/year, gasoline consumption of 10 l/100 km (price 55 ₽/l), gas consumption of 12 l/100 km (price 35 ₽/l): Savings = 110,000 - 84,000 = 26,000 ₽/year.

faqItems.q: What is the gas consumption compared to gasoline?
faqItems.a: Gas consumption is usually 10-20% higher than gasoline consumption due to the lower calorific value of gas. If a car consumes 10 liters of gasoline per 100 km, gas consumption will be approximately 11-12 liters per 100 km. This is a normal difference and is taken into account when calculating savings.

faqItems.q: How much does it cost to install HBO?
faqItems.a: The cost of installing gas equipment depends on the type of equipment, the number of engine cylinders and the region. On average, installing a 4th generation gas equipment costs 35,000-50,000 rubles, and a 5th generation gas equipment costs 50,000-80,000 rubles. 6th generation HBO can cost 80,000-120,000 rubles.

faqItems.q: What is the payback period for LPG with a mileage of 15,000 km per year?
faqItems.a: With a mileage of 15,000 km/year and a difference in prices for gasoline and gas of 20 ₽/l, the payback for gas equipment will be approximately 2-2.5 years. With more mileage the payback is faster, with less mileage the payback is slower. The exact calculation depends on fuel consumption and prices in the region.

faqItems.q: Why is gas consumption higher than gasoline consumption?
faqItems.a: Gas has a lower calorific value compared to gasoline (about 46 MJ/kg for propane versus 44 MJ/kg for gasoline), but due to the lower energy density per unit volume, the consumption per liter is 10-20% higher. This is normal and is taken into account in the calculations.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the payback period for gas equipment?
faqItems.a: Payback period = Installation cost / (Annual savings / 12). For example, installation 45,000 ₽, annual savings 26,000 ₽: Payback period = 45,000 / (26,000 / 12) = 45,000 / 2167 = 20.8 months ≈ 1.7 years.

faqItems.q: Is HBO beneficial for low mileage?
faqItems.a: With low mileage (less than 10,000-15,000 km/year), LPG can pay for itself in 3-4 years or more, which makes the installation less attractive. However, if you plan to increase the mileage or keep the car for a long time, the installation may be worth it.

faqItems.q: What price difference between gasoline and gas should there be for the installation of LPG to be profitable?
faqItems.a: For a profitable installation of HBO, the difference should be at least 15-20 ₽/l. With a smaller difference, the payback may exceed 3-4 years. The optimal difference is 20-30 ₽/l, which ensures payback in 1-2 years with a mileage of 20,000+ km/year.

faqItems.q: How to take gas equipment maintenance into account when calculating payback?
faqItems.a: When calculating the payback, take into account the cost of gas equipment maintenance: replacing gas filters (2000-3000 ₽ every 10,000-15,000 km), setting up equipment (1000-2000 ₽ once a year). This can increase the payback period by 2-3 months.

faqItems.q: Will HBO pay for itself in a year?
faqItems.a: HBO pays for itself in a year with high mileage (30,000+ km/year) and a significant difference in prices for gasoline and gas (20+ ₽/l). With an average mileage of 20,000 km/year, the payback is 1.5-2 years, with low mileage (10,000 km/year) - 3-4 years.

faqItems.q: What mileage is needed for a quick payback for gas equipment?
faqItems.a: For a quick payback for gas equipment (6-12 months), a long mileage is required - from 30,000 km/year or more. At this range, the fuel savings are significant and quickly cover the cost of installation. This is normal mileage for commercial vehicles.

faqItems.q: How to calculate savings per 1 km when using LPG?
faqItems.a: Saving per 1 km = (Gasoline consumption / 100 × Gasoline price) - (Gas consumption / 100 × Gas price). For example, gasoline consumption is 10 l/100 km (55 ₽/l), gas consumption is 12 l/100 km (35 ₽/l): Savings = (10/100 × 55) - (12/100 × 35) = 5.5 - 4.2 = 1.3 ₽/km.

faqItems.q: Does the type of engine affect the payback of gas equipment?
faqItems.a: Engine type affects fuel consumption and installation cost. Installation on injection engines is simpler and cheaper, on carburetor engines it is more difficult. Gas consumption depends on the type of engine, but is usually 10-20% more than gasoline consumption.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the payback of gas equipment for a truck?
faqItems.a: For trucks with high mileage (50,000+ km/year), LPG pays for itself very quickly - in 6-12 months. The formula is the same: Payback period = Installation cost / (Annual savings / 12). High consumption and long mileage provide significant savings.

faqItems.q: Is engine power loss taken into account in the calculation?
faqItems.a: Engine power loss on gas is usually 5-10% and can have a minor impact on fuel consumption and economy. However, this impact is usually small and not critical for calculating payback. Most drivers don't notice a significant difference.

faqItems.q: How often does HBO need to be serviced?
faqItems.a: Gas equipment requires regular maintenance: replacing gas filters every 10,000-15,000 km (2000-3000 ₽), setting up equipment once a year (1000-2000 ₽), checking the tightness of connections. These costs must be taken into account when calculating the return on investment.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to install HBO on a diesel engine?
faqItems.a: Diesel engines are equipped not with LPG (gas), but with LPG for diesel (methane) or dual-fuel systems. Such systems are more expensive and more complex, the payback may be different. Installation of methane equipment is usually considered.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the payback of LPG with a price difference of 25 ₽/l?
faqItems.a: With a difference of 25 ₽/l and a mileage of 20,000 km/year, gasoline consumption of 10 l/100 km: Savings = 20,000 × 10 / 100 × 25 = 50,000 ₽/year. With an installation cost of 45,000 ₽: Payback period = 45,000 / (50,000 / 12) = 10.8 months ≈ 11 months.

faqItems.q: What is the savings in the first year of using HBO?
faqItems.a: First year savings = Annual savings - (Installation cost / Payback period in years). For example, annual savings 26,000 ₽, installation 45,000 ₽, payback period 1.7 years: Savings for the first year = 26,000 - (45,000 / 1.7) = 26,000 - 26,471 = -471 ₽ (not paid off yet).

faqItems.q: How to calculate savings over 3 years of using HBO?
faqItems.a: Savings over 3 years = (Annual Savings × 3) - Installation Cost. For example, annual savings 26,000 ₽, installation 45,000 ₽: Savings for 3 years = (26,000 × 3) - 45,000 = 78,000 - 45,000 = 33,000 ₽.

faqItems.q: Does the type of gas equipment (generation) affect the payback?
faqItems.a: The type of gas equipment affects the cost of installation: the 4th generation gas equipment is cheaper (35,000-50,000 rubles), but may have higher consumption. 5th generation gas equipment is more expensive (50,000-80,000 rubles), but more economical. More expensive equipment takes longer to pay for itself, but may provide better savings.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the payback of gas equipment for several cars?
faqItems.a: To calculate the total payback for multiple vehicles, add up the installation cost of all vehicles and the total annual savings: Total payback period = Total installation cost / (Total annual savings / 12).

faqItems.q: How to take into account changes in fuel prices when calculating?
faqItems.a: When calculating the payback, use current prices for gasoline and gas. If prices change, recalculate the savings. Gas prices typically rise slower than gasoline prices, which can improve your payback over time.

faqItems.q: Is HBO profitable for an old car?
faqItems.a: LPG for an old car can be beneficial if long-term operation and sufficient mileage are planned. However, please note that the cost of installation should be commensurate with the cost of the car. On a very old car, installation may not be justified.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the payback of gas equipment taking into account discounts and promotions?
faqItems.a: When calculating, take into account the actual cost of installation, taking into account discounts and promotions. A 10-20% discount on installation can reduce the payback period by 2-3 months. Use the current installation price in your calculations.

faqItems.q: What is the minimum mileage for HBO to pay for itself?
faqItems.a: The minimum mileage for gas equipment to pay for itself within a reasonable period of time (2-3 years) is 15,000-20,000 km/year with a difference in gasoline and gas prices of 20 ₽/l. With less mileage, the payback period exceeds 3-4 years, which may not be profitable.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the payback of gas equipment when using a loan for installation?
faqItems.a: When using a loan, consider the interest: Actual Installation Cost = Installation Cost + Loan Interest. Payback period = Actual cost / (Annual savings / 12). A loan increases the payback period, but may allow you to install gas equipment immediately.

faqItems.q: Does the region influence the payback of gas equipment?
faqItems.a: The region influences the prices of gasoline and gas, which directly affects the return on investment. In regions with a large price difference (20+ ₽/l), the payback is faster. Also, in regions with a developed network of gas filling stations, it is more convenient to use LPG.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the payback of gas equipment with partial use of gas?
faqItems.a: If using gas partially (for example, 70% on gas, 30% on gasoline), recalculate the savings: Savings = (Annual Savings × Proportion of Gas Use). For example, if you use gas 70% of the time: Savings = 26,000 × 0.7 = 18,200 ₽/year, the payback period will increase.

faqItems.q: What difference should there be between the price of gasoline and gas?
faqItems.a: For a profitable installation of LPG, the difference between the price of gasoline and gas should be at least 15-20 ₽/l. The optimal difference is 20-30 ₽/l. With a smaller difference, the payback may exceed 3-4 years, which makes the installation less attractive.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the payback of gas equipment taking into account tax benefits?
faqItems.a: In some regions there are tax breaks for transport tax when using gas equipment (reduction by 10-30%). Take these savings into account when calculating: Total savings = Fuel savings + Tax savings. This may shorten the payback period.

faqItems.q: Is LPG beneficial for mileage less than 10,000 km per year?
faqItems.a: With a mileage of less than 10,000 km/year, LPG pays off for a very long time (4-5 years or more), which makes the installation unprofitable. In such cases, installing an LPG is usually not recommended unless there are plans to increase mileage.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the payback of gas equipment taking into account inflation?
faqItems.a: For long-term calculations (3+ years), take into account fuel price inflation. Gas prices typically rise more slowly than gasoline, which can improve the payback over time. For an accurate calculation, use forecasts of price increases or current prices with adjustments.

howTo.title: How to calculate the payback of HBO
howTo.description: Step-by-step instructions for using the LPG payback calculator

step1.name: Enter the cost of installing LPG
step1.text: Indicate the cost of installing gas equipment in your region (usually 35,000-80,000 rubles depending on the generation)

step2.name: Enter annual mileage
step2.text: Enter the actual annual mileage of your car in kilometers. This is critical for accurately calculating ROI.

step3.name: Enter fuel consumption
step3.text: Indicate gasoline consumption per 100 km from the car's passport and gas consumption (usually 10-20% more than gasoline consumption)

step4.name: Specify fuel prices
step4.text: Enter current gasoline and gas prices in your area. Gas is usually 30-40% cheaper than gasoline.

step5.name: Get the result
step5.text: The calculator will automatically calculate the payback period of gas equipment, annual and monthly savings, fuel cost for the year and savings over several years
